member.name: F:Fake.TwitterHelper.TwitterClientInfo.ClientUrl
member.summary: Sets the URL of the Twitter client. Must be in the XML format documented in the "Request Headers" section at: http://twitter.pbwiki.com/API-Docs. According to the Twitter Fan Wiki at http://twitter.pbwiki.com/API-Docs and supported by the Twitter developers, this will be used in the future (hopefully near) to set more information in Twitter about the client posting the information as well as future usage in a clients directory.

member.name: F:Fake.TwitterHelper.TwitterClientInfo.ClientVersion
member.summary: Sets the version of the Twitter client. According to the Twitter Fan Wiki at http://twitter.pbwiki.com/API-Docs and supported by the Twitter developers, this will be used in the future (hopefully near) to set more information

member.name: F:Fake.TwitterHelper.TwitterClientInfo.ClientName
member.summary: Sets the name of the Twitter client. According to the Twitter Fan Wiki at http://twitter.pbwiki.com/API-Docs and supported by the Twitter developers, this will be used in the future (hopefully near) to set more information in Twitter about the client posting the information as well as future usage in a clients directory.

member.name: F:Fake.TwitterHelper.TwitterClientInfo.Source
member.summary: Source is an additional parameters that will be used to fill the "From" field. Currently you must talk to the developers of Twitter at: http://groups.google.com/group/twitter-development-talk/ Otherwise, Twitter will simply ignore this parameter and set the "From" field to "web".

member.name: T:Fake.TwitterHelper.TwitterAction
member.summary: The various actions used at Twitter. Not all actions works on all object types. For more information about the actions types and the supported functions Check the Twitter documentation at: http://groups.google.com/group/twitter-development-talk/web/api-documentation

member.name: T:Fake.TwitterHelper.TwitterObject
member.summary: The various object types supported at Twitter.

member.name: T:Fake.TwitterHelper.TwitterFormat
member.summary: The output formats supported by Twitter. Not all of them can be used with all of the functions. For more information about the output formats and the supported functions check the Twitter documentation at: http://groups.google.com/group/twitter-development-talk/web/api-documentation

member.name: M:Fake.ZipHelper.Zip(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary:
Creates a zip file with the given files
Parameter 1: workingDir - The relative dir of the zip files. Use this parameter to influence directory structure within zip file. Parameter 2: fileName - The fileName of the resulting zip file. Parameter 3: files - A sequence with files to zip.
